channel.title: Books on Learn, Converse, Share
channel.description: Recent content in Books on Learn, Converse, Share

item.title: Pro Git Cliff Notes
item.description: These are my notes from reading Scott Chacon’s Pro Git I highly suggest buying this book if you are serious about using the Git version control tool. pg 48 A branch in Git is simply a lightweight movable pointer pg 50 a special pointer called HEAD…is a pointer to the local branch you’re currently on pg 52 Creating a new branch is as quick and simple as writing 41 bytes to a file (40 characters and a newline). pg 53 To create a branch and switch to it at the same time…git checkout command with the -b switch pg 61 To see the last commit on each branch, you can run git branch -v pg 69

item.title: Thoughts about reading computer books
item.description: I have been coding ASP.NET for about 4 years now.  I had a co-worker bring a book to work titled “Essential ASP.NET” by Fritz Onion.  I skimmed it and it looked very interesting do to it’s text on application pools and low level information that I’ve always taken for granted.  I finished reading a few of the other books lounging around my house and decided that I wanted to read it.  I inquired with my co-worker on that very thing and he told me he had given it to another co-worker.  To make a long story short, I’m currently borrowing that copy of the text.
